title: Wandering Ponderer
imageURL: The results of a weather search on the 'Odin's Forecast' weather app
description: A personal travel site for an explorer, writer, and overthinker.
caseDescription: A weather app built to deliver only the most important weather information. This was built using vanilla JS. Everything else was also coded by hand. The results? It can run in any browser, works on mobile and desktop while using the ES6 JS syntax for beautiful code that's easily understood by other developers.

title: Odin's Forecast
imageURL: The results of a weather search on the 'Odin's Forecast' weather app
description: A clean weather app built to deliver the most important info. Clean code, clean design, clean results.
caseDescription: A weather app built to deliver only the most important weather information. This was built using vanilla JS. Everything else was also coded by hand. The results? It can run in any browser, works on mobile and desktop while using the ES6 JS syntax for beautiful code that's easily understood by other developers.

title: Root
imageURL: Home page of the Root design
description: A Proof-of-Concept dashboard design for a South African fitness app.
caseDescription: Vertical rhythm, clever use of whitespace, and a focus on functionality resulted in this Proof-of-Concept design for the initial stages of a fitness app's development stage. Function over form was prioritized without sacrificing fundamental design principles and respect for usability. Code styl here was written agnostically so that developer handoff would be even easier. Clean, semantic HTML complements a practical design.

title: Dan's Meditation
description: A re-design of a fellow front-end developer's meditation app.
caseDescription: Danny was in the process of building a meditation app for download on the Google Play Store. I offered my help with the design. The result was a more visually consistent design rooted in strong vertical rhythm, sizing, and colour principles. Check AdobeXD for plenty of text about the design and rationale behind decisions.

title: Battleships
imageURL: Battleships screen after a user has beaten the computer
description: The classic childhood game reimagined as a modern browser-based game built using the latest front-end web technologies.
caseDescription: The classic childhood game reimagined as a modern web application built using the latest front-end web technologies. Users battle against the computer in this turn-based game playable on your desktop or mobile browsers. React application full of beautiful unit tests, Object-Oriented programming design principles, and the best parts of JS functional programming

title: Eventor
description: A web app for event creation and user signup management
caseDescription: The aim was to build a web app similar to Eventbrite in functionality. Users can sign up, create events, invite other users, and manage attendees of their events.
